author: @wymt
title: FIRST ALERT WEATHER DAY: Wintry Mix Chance This Evening
text:
FIRST ALERT WEATHER DAY: Wintry Mix Chance This Evening
We had a cloudy and dreary Wednesday throughout Eastern Kentucky.
As of 5 PM, some places picked up as little as .10″ of rain, while others, especially near Harlan, picked up .71″ of rain.
We will keep the chance of rain in the forecast this evening.
It will transition to snow as we roll into the overnight hours and into the morning hours of your Thursday.
Once this system pushes through in the late morning hours, we will see the clouds decrease, which will leave us with plenty of sunshine.
Then we head into Friday and the weekend where another round of rain will swing through Friday Night and into the day on Saturday.
We will get a break in the afternoon hours and another round swings in Saturday night and Sunday Morning.
Highs this weekend will be in the upper 40s and low 50s.
We will clear out and warm up for the start of next week with lots of sunshine and highs in the low 60s for Monday and upper 60s and even low 70s by next Tuesday and Wednesday.
Enjoy your evening.
Tonight: Chance of Wintry Mix. Wind: W 10-15.
LOW: 31
Tomorrow: AM Chance of Wintry Mix. Mostly Sunny. Wind: W 10-15.
HIGH: 44
Tom. Night: Partly Cloudy. Wind: WSW 5-10.
LOW: 30
Friday: PM Slight Chance of Showers. Partly Cloudy. Wind: SSE 5-10.
HIGH: 57 LOW: 41
Saturday: AM Chance of Showers. Mostly Sunny.
HIGH: 50 LOW: 33
Sunday: Mostly Sunny.
HIGH: 54 LOW: 33
Monday: Sunny.
HIGH: 62 LOW: 40
Tuesday: Sunny.
HIGH: 70 LOW: 45
Wednesday: Sunny.
HIGH: 72 LOW: 54
